Docs.summary: Provides classes that write XPS documents to a data store or print queue.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter> class provides the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter.Write%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter.WriteAsync%2A> methods that output XPS documents to a data store or print queue. Separate groups of write methods are provided for different content types including <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPaginator>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Visual>, <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage>, <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument>, and <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocumentSequence>. The <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter> methods enable you to also include a <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket> with the document, plus pass additional information to the handlers of the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter.WritingCompleted>, <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter.WritingProgressChanged>, and <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter.WritingPrintTicketRequired> events.
For more information about XPS, see the [XML Paper Specification (XPS)](https://www.ecma-international.org/publications-and-standards/standards/ecma-388/).
